metadata.context: Professional setting where different stakeholders have competing interests
metadata.architect_notes: Focus on pragmatic softening and tension repair. Learners often fail because they either refuse outright or overexplain their position. This curriculum teaches authentic softening + counter-proposal.

communicative_outcomes.outcome: Learner can soften disagreement without hostility or loss of assertiveness
communicative_outcomes.description: Learner uses softening phrases (hedges, mitigators) before expressing different opinion. Maintains assertiveness about key point while showing understanding of other position.
communicative_outcomes.cefr_relevance: B2 - Fluency and spontaneity: Can express personal opinions without extensive preparation

communicative_outcomes.outcome: Learner can recognize and repair conversational tension mid-dialogue
communicative_outcomes.description: When conversation becomes heated or breaks down, learner uses repair markers (clarification requests, apologies, reframing) to restore collaborative tone.
communicative_outcomes.cefr_relevance: B2 - Handling unforeseen turns: Can adapt communication style when conversation goes off track
communicative_outcomes.learning_level: Very complex (requires real-time monitoring + strategic intervention)

communicative_outcomes.outcome: Learner can propose multiple alternatives to reach agreement
communicative_outcomes.description: Rather than accepting or rejecting outright, learner suggests creative solutions that address both parties' core concerns (e.g., 'Could we split the deadline?' 'What if I delivered in phases?').
communicative_outcomes.cefr_relevance: B2 - Expressing opinions: Can express and defend personal opinions, negotiate compromises

fluency.metric: Pauses decrease 30% from Stage 1 to Stage 3
fluency.measurement: Automated: <1 second pauses in Stage 1, <0.5 seconds in Stage 3
fluency.rationale: Chunks are pre-planned in Stage 1 (more pauses). In Stage 3, learner retrieves spontaneously (fewer pauses).

spontaneity.metric: Chunks appear spontaneously, not read from notes
spontaneity.measurement: Human observation: Learner delivers softeners without glancing at reference
spontaneity.rationale: True automaticity = chunks are in working memory, not external memory

pragmatic_accuracy.metric: Softeners used in ≥75% of disagreement moments
pragmatic_accuracy.measurement: Dialogue analysis: Count softeners before each contrasting opinion
pragmatic_accuracy.rationale: If learner softens in 3 out of 4 disagreements, pragmatic competence is demonstrated

authenticity.metric: Native speaker evaluator: 'Sounds natural, not scripted'
authenticity.rationale: Would a native speaker recognize this as authentic workplace negotiation?

retention.metric: Chunks reappear in subsequent scenarios without rehearsal
retention.measurement: Learner uses softeners in Scenario 3 without seeing them in Scenario 2
retention.rationale: Transfer across contexts = deep learning, not surface learning

stage_1.name: Recognition + Recall
stage_1.example_blank: I see your point, but ___ we extend the deadline? (A) should (B) can (C) could
stage_1.feedback_tone: Encouraging: 'Good! That's how we soften disagreement.'

stage_2.name: Guided Production
stage_2.example_blank: I understand your deadline pressure, [t__ be ____ ], we need more time.
stage_2.support: first letter + context hints, no full answer
stage_2.learner_task: Retrieve softener from memory + deliver it
stage_2.feedback_tone: Constructive: 'Almost! The softener needs 2 words. Think of 'To be ...'

stage_3.name: Semi-Authentic Task
stage_3.example_blank: [CUES: Manager just proposed unrealistic deadline. You need to soften disagreement.] Learner: ___
stage_3.feedback_tone: Positive + growth-focused: 'You softened well in turn 3. What about turn 5?'

stage_4.name: Authentic Negotiation
stage_4.example: Unrehearsed roleplay with dynamic partner behavior
stage_4.success_metric: Peer evaluation + self-reflection on pragmatic competence
stage_4.feedback_tone: Collaborative: 'What softeners did you use? How did they land?'

alignment_notes.to_task_designer: These outcomes require authentic tension (manager-colleague conflict) and multiple solution paths (different ways to soften + negotiate)
alignment_notes.to_chunk_curator: Need chunks for: hedge (To be honest, I see your point), mitigate (maybe, possibly), concede (you're right that), repair (Let me rephrase), suggest (Could we, What if, How about)
alignment_notes.to_system_builder: Blank placement should prioritize softening phrases > repair markers > negotiation starters. Stage 3 should test spontaneity, Stage 4 should be zero support.
